chapters.title: Introduction to the Course & Prehistoric Medicine
Prehistoric Medicine
chapters.description: Neanderthal self-medication (El Sidrón cave), earliest herbal medicine (yarrow/chamomile), trepanning since 10,000 BCE, Mehrgarh dentistry (9,000 years ago), surgical amputation evidence (Borneo 31,000 BCE, France 7,000 BCE), shamanism, Ötzi the Iceman (fungus antibiotics, acupuncture-like tattoos), geophagy, willow bark (salicin/aspirin precursor)

chapters.title: Medicine in Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia
chapters.description: Imhotep (earliest physician/deified healer), Hesy-Ra (first dentist/diabetes documentation), Blocked Channel Theory (46 channels from heart), medical papyri (Smith/Ebers/Kahun), Egyptian surgery/prosthetics/mummies, Mesopotamian ashipu/ashu dual system, cuneiform medical tablets, Hammurabi Code medical liability
